intro: Elytropappus rhinocerotis, commonly known as the horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, winged seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Elytropappus rhinocerotis is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species.
